paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on TTR gene variants, including penetrance data and individual records.

patients.phenotype: ATTRv amyloidosis, with some cases presenting with cardiomyopathy

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Of the individuals in the index dataset, 46 individuals (31%) had ATTRv-CM.
101 individuals (69%) were either TTRv carriers or ATTRv amyloidosis patients without cardiomyopathy.

functional_data.summary: The variant leads to the production of unstable transthyretin protein that readily dissociates into misfolded monomers.

variants.segregation_data: Segregates with disease in families, as indicated by the familial nature of ATTRv amyloidosis.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on clinical presentation and familial segregation.
variants.additional_notes: The study included a comprehensive analysis of TTR variants and their clinical implications.
key_quotes: Individuals carrying a pathogenic transthyretin gene variant (TTRv) are at high risk for developing hereditary transthyretin (ATTRv) amyloidosis.

extraction_metadata.notes: Data was extracted thoroughly from the main text, with a focus on TTR variants.
